name: Learn to Code San Antonio
description: Ever tried learning to code on your own with codecademy.com? Every thought about learning how to build websites but didn't know where to start? Here you can meet other people in the exact same spot who are curious, excited, and interested in exploring the fundamentals of web development. Each event will be guided by an expert who will teach a new skill and get us started on the path to programming fluency. Some of the topics we will cover: • Intro to HTML and CSS • Intro to Javascript • Intro to Git and GitHub • Intro to jQuery, Angular, Node.js (if your not sure what these are yet, no problem) All levels are welcome to attend. We feel that getting beginners and more advanced developers together is where the magic happens. This Meetup is owned and operated by Austin Coding Academy: San Antonio, which offers a 9-month course in full stack web development. These events are a way for people in San Antonio to get some free help and find out if taking a class with us makes sense or not. Our mission is to provide affordable, accessible coding education. For all inquiries, including food and drink or other sponsorship, please reach out to Chris Sica at chris@austincodingacademy.com

name: S O L A R I S of Canaan - New Age Spirituality Meetup
description: We base our spiritual practice upon the consecration of TRUTH. We venerate a heliocentric reality through the ongoing development of a Scientific Philosophy that recognizes the Laws of Nature - those esoteric nodes of Reality that encompass the Natural Order (Laws of Physics) which are the source of our Manifestation as Evolutionary aspects of the Cosmos. Cosmic Creation is the greatest story that CAN be told ! WE are the Eyes straining to See, the Fingers reaching to Grasp, the MIND of this Cosmos yearning to Know and to Understand Ourselves. Rejoice, Reach Out, Rise Up, and INSPIRE this quest and your Life as part of this Creation.

name: Ottawa Amazon Web Services/OpenStack/Docker Developer Group
description:
As of 20151223 this group has expanded to include private cloud OpenStack deployments as well as docker containers on both public (AWS) and private clouds.

These meetings ideally would be all hands on where developers with AWS accounts can collaborate and share design and implementation ideas and issues.

Members of this group would benefit the most if they have heir own Mac or windows laptop and have been using a personal or corporate AWS account for current development.

http://aws.amazon.com/

Depending on who is at these meeting we can go over any development issues surrounding EC2, ElasticBeanstalk, ECS, S3, RDS, DynamoDB or other API's that is of interest to the group.

I am new to both the Elastic Container Service running on docker and the Lambda SaaS running on Node.js.

I find M2M automation (DevOps) interesting as well - we could discuss automation of CI and CD using Attlassian bamboo builds and deploys to EB instances running on EC2.

We can also discuss anything else related to general cloud computing alternatives like the PaaS offerings like google AppSpot, Oracle Cloud and Pivotal CloudFoundry.

organizer.name: Michael O'Brien AWS Java dev
organizer.bio: Senior Java Developer SDN at Alcatel-Lucent

name: DevHause
description: Hablemos sobre JavaScript, Node, Angular y Mongo, con unas chelas y tacos.

name: DevDays Coatzacoalcos
description: ¿Interesado en Node.js, PHP, Java, OpenSource, Startups, Frameworks y demás? Este es el meetup para ti. Ven y habla de tu siguiente emprendimiento, encuentra co-founders y pasa un buen rato con pizza obligatoria.

name: DenMARK - Denver MarkLogic User's Group
description:
DenMARK, the MarkLogic User Group Denver, is a group for users and/or fans of MarkLogic and those who are interested in learning more about MarkLogic Enterprise NoSQL database technology. We'll host informal events for users to meet, discuss, and share best practices. This is an easy way to meet peers and learn how to get more out of MarkLogic Server. This is your Meetup group, so please tell us what you would like to hear!

Want to know more about MarkLogic?  Read on >>

MarkLogic® is a new generation database platform that enables organisations to get more value from more data than ever before. Global enterprises and governments rely on MarkLogic to power intelligent, high performance applications aimed at analysing data for better insights and also running crucial day-to-day business operations. With MarkLogic, organisations achieve faster time-to-value than was possible with legacy databases, while minimising risk and improving data quality.

MarkLogic is the only Enterprise NoSQL database—a powerful, agile, trusted database that has the speed and scale of NoSQL coupled with the enterprise features required.

· Develop stronger applications faster with a flexible data model using Full-Stack JavaScript, JSON and Node.JS

· Find relevant information easier with lightning fast, built-in search

· Gain more intelligence in the data layer using semantics and bitemporal

· Maintain data resiliency and consistency with ACID transactions, scalability and elasticity, certified security,   and high availability and disaster recovery

name: Graph Nerds of Boulder
description: Do you look at the world as nodes and edges? Does Big Data make you salivate a little? We are getting together to discuss the latest in graph databases, modeling, libraries, data sets, and analysis. People wanting to discuss inner/outer joins need not apply.

organizer.name: Neo4j
organizer.bio:
(graphs) - [:ARE] - > (everywhere)

Neo4j is the world's leading graph database with the largest ecosystem of partners & tens of thousands of successful deployments, with over 40 Global 2000 customers like Cisco, Accenture, Telenor, eBay & Walmart.

name: NodeSchool YQR
description: Learn to program in JavaScript and Node.js! NodeSchool is a series of community learning events held worldwide, comprised of open-source workshops that teach web software skills. On November 19th, GasBuddy is bringing NodeSchool to YQR -- join us at the Rotunda in Innovation Place from 1:00-4:00 PM to work through challenges with peers and mentors. Bring your laptop! Previous coding experience helpful but not necessary.

name: Ciudad Bolívar Arduino-Node Meetup
description: "Arduino, Nodejs, tambien un poco de domotica y drones"

name: Think it Code it (of San Diego)
description:
Welcome to the Microsoft Mobile App Developers Meet Up!

Our MISSION:To bring together developers who are building anything with code. 

What we will cover:

IOT, Javascript, Node, IOT data ingestion and analyzing, Maker stuff, rasberry pi, edison, git and github, docker, web, and the list goes on.   We really want this group to be able to show off cool code on cool projects no matter what the tech is. 



Make sure to RSVP to our upcoming events. Upcoming events will be held the 4TH Tuesday of Every month!

organizer.name: DanielEgan
organizer.bio:
Developer Evangelist - Microsoft
Former President INETA – North America
Former Microsoft Regional Director
Microsoft MVP ASP/ASP.Net , MCSD, MCT
Former Chief Arcitect and CEO of Odyssey Consulting Group. Blog: http://www.DotNetDoc.com.

name: San Diego Startup Fusion
description:
Imagine if there was a place, where at one table an entrepreneur meets her next $100,000 investor. A designer meets a new client, a web developer with a great internet startup. A Ruby on Rails or NODE.JS engineer meets a charismatic founder that excites him with his vision, so much so that he can picture leaving his day job for the exhilarating experience of working tirelessly for technology stock options that could be worth millions one day... #SDStartupFusion

We're building this community.

organizer.name: Lee Decker
organizer.bio: Lee is in the startup world as a founding partner in companies around the world; and as a partner & CMO of Conservaco, where Lee leads the creative team in ad-tech, big data, online media buys & crowdfunding.

name: Red Hat San Diego
description:
This group is focused on bringing together the Southern California Red Hat User Community for business and technical presentations, conversations and perhaps some food and drink. Membership is open to Red Hat customers, partners and people interested in Red Hat technologies.

Some of the Red Hat products are: Red Hat Enterprise Linux, OpenStack, Storage (Ceph, GlusterFS), Virtualization (ovirt, kvm), CloudForms, FeedHenry (Node.js, Apache Cordova), JBoss Fuse (Apache Camel, Fabric8), JBoss BPM (jBPM), JBoss Data Virtualization (Teiid), JBoss EAP (Wildfly), JBoss JWS (Apache Tomcat), JBoss Data Grid (Infinispan), JBoss A-MQ (Apache ActiveMQ), JBoss BRMS (Drools), OpenShift (Jenkins, Git, Kubernetes, Docker, OpenVSwitch, RHEL, RHEL Atomic).

organizer.name: Crystal Murphy
organizer.bio: I manage events for North America in the Regional Demand Center of Red Hat.

name: Augmented Reality Meetup (ARM)
description: You develop for the Hololens or Meta. You've been scanning 3d spaces or create 3d models with either Maya, Blender or 3DS Max. You understand the potential and power of AR for business and the ultimate crossover with VR as Merged reality. You've played with Unity or UE and aren't scared of C++ nor node dev. You know the future has no screens nor a keyboard. Welcome home.

organizer.name: VRoomCam
organizer.bio: A robotics and machine learning startup dedicated to VR and AR capture through locomotion. Bringing life to VR and solving the locomotion problem got us started, VRoomCam wishes to engage Idaho to create a metaverse with a heart.

name: Learn to Code.
description:
Learn to Code in Orange County

Presented by: Orange County Code School

We will be learning to code using the following techniques and technologies:

• Javascript

• jQuery 

• Angular.js 

• node.js 

• express.js 

• jade templates 

• HTML5 and CSS3 

• Less and Sass 

• Grunt 

• Karma 

• Jasmine 

• MongoDB

This meeting is for novice and experienced coders. We will be learning to code as a group. Bring your laptop and your coding questions.

organizer.name: Ron Perris
organizer.bio: Software Developer interested in software security.

name: HackDojo Women: Hackers & Developers
description:
Hack Dojo Women Hackers is dedicated to cultivating more female developers and fostering a community of confident, ambitious, and collaborative women.

“We believe that all women and underprivileged minorities should have the tools to enrich their lives, careers, and communities by encouraging them to learn how to code, engaging them in innovative projects, and empowering them to seek opportunities in the tech industry.” 

LEARN TO CODE. CHANGE THE WORLD. HACKDOJO.

HackDojo is a place of study, and collaboration dedicated to learn coding to create a better future. HackDojo is a self-directed, coding program for people who want to learn or get better at programming. 

Come learn or meet people with the following skills:
HTML5 and CSS3
Twitter Bootstrap
JavaScript fundamentals and Libraries
jQuery and AJAX
Angular.JS
Node.js
MongoDB
Express.js
jQuery Mobile
AppGyver
Phonegap
Ruby on Rails
LAMP Stack
iOS Swift
Android
APIs
Web Socket
Stripe
Test Driven Development
Deployment
Git and Github
Docker
PHP/MySQL
Python

..join us at our next meetup event and meet other founders, hackers, coders, programmers and aspiring developers!

Learn more at HackDojo.com!

organizer.name: Ounie Phakousonh
organizer.bio: Director at School of Devs - Web and Mobile Development Bootcamp in Orange County, CA.

name: Socal Software Developers
description: Anyone interested in or using Node.js, Javascript, CoffeeScript, and other related frameworks/technologies in the Los Angeles / Southern California Area

name: Los Angeles CoffeeScript
description:
What is CoffeeScript?

CoffeeScript is a little language that compiles into JavaScript. Underneath that awkward Java-esque patina, JavaScript has always had a gorgeous heart. CoffeeScript is an attempt to expose the good parts of JavaScript in a simple way.

For a quick introduction to CoffeeScript check out Panda Strike's Introduction to CoffeeScript

 

Who We Are

We're a group of professionals so in love with CoffeeScript we've developed our own tutorials. We're starting this meetup to show others why we enjoy developing in CoffeeScript and to interact with others who are also using CoffeeScript.

 

What To Expect

Some programming experience is assumed. For people who are new to CoffeeScript we'll provide self-paced tutorials. For people who are further advanced we'll have projects to work on and talk about, people to argue with.

 

Sponsors

 

 

 

 

Panda Strike is a consultancy focused on rich client, high-performance Web and mobile experiences and lightweight solutions for big data, primarily using CoffeeScript, Node.js, Elaticsearch, and a stack of innovative open source technologies. Panda Strike is hiring talented engineers.


Sponsoring

If you're interested in hosting hack night or sponsoring food or drinks then send Lance Lakey an email through meetup.com
